quiz.title: Unit 6: Work, Energy & Power (Quiz 7)
quiz.subtitle: Potential Energy and Energy Loss (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A 2 kg book is held 1.5 m above the floor. What is its $PE_g$ relative to the floor? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A 50 kg diver stands on a board 10 m above the water. What is the diver's $PE_g$ relative to the water? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A 0.5 kg ball is moved from a height of 2 m to a height of 5 m. What is the change in its $PE_g$? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
How much work is required to lift a 10 kg crate from the ground to a shelf 2 m high? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A 1 kg ball is dropped from a height of 5 m. Just before it hits the ground, what is its kinetic energy? (Assume no air resistance, $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A 2 kg object has a $PE_g$ of $-40 \text{ J}$ relative to the tabletop. This means the object is: (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A $10 \text{ kg}$ crate is pushed $4 \text{ m}$ across a floor with a friction force of $20 \text{ N}$. The energy lost to heat is:
questions.explanation: Energy lost = work by friction = $F_f \times d = 20 \times 4 = 80$ J.

questions.question: A $5 \text{ kg}$ block slides down a $10 \text{ m}$ long ramp inclined at $45^\circ$. If the coefficient of kinetic friction is $0.20$, how much energy is converted to thermal energy? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

A $50 \text{ kg}$ crate is moving at $12 \text{ m/s}$ on a horizontal floor. If it slides $8 \text{ m}$ before coming to a stop due to friction, how much work was done by friction, and what happened to that energy?
questions.explanation: $KE_i = \frac{1}{2} \times 50 \times 144 = 3600$ J. $W_{fric} = \Delta KE = -3600$ J, converted to heat.

questions.question: A $200 \text{ kg}$ roller coaster car starts from rest at the top of a $40 \text{ m}$ hill. At the bottom of the hill, it has $70,000 \text{ J}$ of kinetic energy. How much energy was 'lost' to friction and air resistance during the descent? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered potential energy and energy loss concepts.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review how energy is converted to heat by friction.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on $PE = mgh$ and work-energy relationships.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study gravitational potential energy and how friction dissipates energy.
